pullRequest.title: Get Data compression only for non-indexed SQL Server tables

nodes.bodyText: Please move GROUP BY and HAVING to new lines.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -428,9 +428,10 @@ public void setNull(PreparedStatement statement, int index)
         return handle.createQuery("" +
                 "SELECT data_compression_desc FROM sys.partitions p " +
                 "INNER JOIN sys.tables t ON p.object_id = t.object_id " +
+                "INNER JOIN sys.schemas s ON t.schema_id = s.schema_id " +
                 "INNER JOIN sys.indexes i ON t.object_id = i.object_id " +
-                "WHERE SCHEMA_NAME(t.schema_id) = :schema AND t.name = :table_name AND i.type IN (0,1) " +
-                "AND i.data_space_id NOT IN (SELECT data_space_id FROM sys.partition_schemes)")
+                "WHERE s.name = :schema AND t.name = :table_name AND p.index_id = 0 AND i.type = 0 " +
+                "AND i.data_space_id NOT IN (SELECT data_space_id FROM sys.partition_schemes) GROUP BY data_compression_desc HAVING count(*) <= 1")

nodes.bodyText:
This is not precise name as SHOW CREATE does not support indexes.
You test Data Compression here.
Could you please rename this method similar to the commit message?

It's harder to compare text with regexp.
It's easier to compare text with text.
Please consider
.matches -> isEqualTo,
\\w+\\.\\w+\\. -> getSession().getCatalog().orElseThrow() + "." + getSession().getSchema().orElseThrow() + "." + 
May be extract common sql part.

+                "   INDEX IX_MyTable4 NONCLUSTERED (key4, key5))\n" +
+                "   WITH (DATA_COMPRESSION = PAGE)");
+
+        assertThat((String) computeActual("SHOW CREATE TABLE IndexedTable").getOnlyValue())
+                .matches("CREATE TABLE \\w+\\.\\w+\\.indexedtable \\Q(\n" +

nodes.bodyText:
p.index_id = 0 AND i.type = 0

why do you need this check?
just for the info:

sys.partitions.index_id
Indicates the ID of the index within the object to which this partition belongs.
0 = heap
1 = clustered index
2 or greater = nonclustered index
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/system-catalog-views/sys-partitions-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15


sys.indexes.type
Type of index:
0 = Heap
1 = Clustered
2 = Nonclustered
3 = XML
4 = Spatial
5 = Clustered columnstore index. Applies to: SQL Server 2014 (12.x) and later.
6 = Nonclustered columnstore index. Applies to: SQL Server 2012 (11.x) and later.
7 = Nonclustered hash index. Applies to: SQL Server 2014 (12.x) and later.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/system-catalog-views/sys-indexes-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15

NonIndexed

the test table is called indexed. is it indexed or non-indexed?

NonPartitioned

remove

TablesWithDataCompression

CompressedTable
Please add comment that SHOW CREATE TABLE does not support indices and table compression yet.
nit: this comment belongs to java now. Once sql code is copied to sql editor this comment is lost. I still think that it has to be within sql.

nodes.bodyText: don't you need to drop pfSales and psSales? The best would be to use io.trino.testing.sql.TestTable (modified somehow) for things like that.

commit.message:
Optimize query to match schema name

Using INNER JOIN with sys.schemas help us with indexes
Drop table and other objects in SQL Server tests
Get Data compression only for non-indexed SQL Server tables

afterCommit.message: Get Data compression only for non-indexed SQL Server tables
